summary: The virus affects both the leaves of the plant and the fruit. . The papaya (pəˈpaɪə, US pəˈpɑːjə), papaw, (pəˈpɔː) or pawpaw (ˈpɔːpɔː) is the plant species Carica papaya, one of the 21 accepted species in the genus Carica of the family Caricaceae, and also the name of its fruit. . The leaves of the papaya fruit turn yellow, gray, or bronze. . The difference between the ringspot and the mosaic viruses is the ripe fruit in the ringspot has a mottling of colors, and the mosaic does not. . In the later stages of the virus, the markings may become gray and crusty.
